revised_title: Comparative Study of Element Spectra, Densities, and Melting Points
tldr: The author conducted a comparative study of the spectra, densities, and melting points of various groups of elements to investigate the relationship between their properties and atomic mass. They found that the spectra of metals in each group are similar to one another and differ from those of other groups, with the positions of lines changing systematically with increasing atomic mass. This study aimed to discover the laws governing the distribution of lines in spectra and the relations between the physical and chemical properties of metals and their spectra.
